rules.name: Pages should use error handling page
Avoid use of standard SQL API
Avoid unreferenced JSPs and web client files
Avoid undocumented Web Server Pages
Avoid large Page files
Check the use of foreach custom tag library
Avoid large Include Files
Avoid large JSP Pages  too many Scriptlets
Avoid large Classes - too many Methods
Avoid large Classes - too many Constructors
Avoid large Classes - too many Fields
Avoid large Interfaces - too many Methods
Avoid declaring Instance Variables without defined access type
Avoid declaring Public Instance Variables
Avoid declaring Non Final Class Variables with Public or Package access type
Avoid declaring Final Instance Variables that are not dynamically initialized
Provide accessors to Private Fields
Good use of Interfaces with collections as Method return types
Good use of Interfaces when instantiating a collection
Avoid using 'java.io.File'
Avoid using 'java.lang.System.getenv()'
Avoid using 'java.lang.Runtime.exec()'
Avoid using 'java.System.exit()'
Avoid using Fields (non static final) from other Classes
Avoid using 'java.lang.Error'
Avoid using 'sun' Classes
Avoid using anonymous Classes
Avoid using native Methods (JNI)
Proper overriding of clone
Proper overriding of finalize
Avoid instantiating Boolean
Avoid direct Class inheritance from java.lang.Throwable
Avoid declaring throwing an exception and not throwing it
Avoid using 'System.gc'
Avoid using 'System.err' and 'System.out' within a try catch block
Avoid using 'System.err' and 'System.out' outside a try catch block
Avoid using Vector
Avoid using Dynamic instantiation
Avoid Classes implementing too many Interfaces
Track Classes referencing Database objects
EJB Entity access through their local Interface
EJB Session access through their local Interface
Action_Mappings_should_have_few_forwards
Each method in an Action Class should have a small complexity
Action Artifacts should not directly call a JSP page
Action Classes should have only one public method
Action Artifacts should not directly use database objects
JSP pages should only reference Java Objects associated to J2EE Scoped Bean
JSP pages should always be accessed through their tiles definition
Favor PreparedStatement or CallableStatement over Statement
Avoid Fields in Servlet Classes that are not final static
Avoid Fields in Action Classes that are not final static
Avoid large number of String concatenation
Check usage of equal and not equal on objects
Avoid method invocation in a loop termination expression
Avoid the use of InstanceOf inside loops
Avoid instantiations inside loops
JSP pages should always be accessed through their tiles definition
Avoid implementing Action Classes inheriting directly from Struts Action
Call superfinalize  in the finally block of finalize methods
Avoid declaring Inner Classes
Avoid using Inner Classes
Avoid SELECT all queries
Avoid action mappings validator turned off
Enable Struts Validator plugin
Avoid unused validation form
Avoid Validator field without Form Field
Avoid artifacts having recursive calls
Avoid using SQL queries inside a loop
Avoid classes overriding only equals or only hashCode
Avoid SELECT all queries
Use lazy fetching for collection
Never use array to map a collection
Define equals and hashCode for component
Avoid static Field of type collection
Use version instead of timestamp
Avoid using DriverManager
Avoid catch blocks with assertion
Avoid calling finalize()
Avoid using incorrect XML parsing model
Avoid_using_specific_logging_implementation
Avoid using session.setFlushMode(FlushMode.COMMIT, FlushMode.NEVER or FlushMode.MANUAL)
Avoid defining singleton or factory when using Spring
Avoid too many EJB bean
Avoid non validated inputs
Avoid to use Log debug without calling Log.isDebugEnabled
Avoid Artifacts with High Cyclomatic Complexity
Avoid Artifacts with High Depth of Code
Avoid Artifacts with too many parameters
Avoid Artifacts with High Essential Complexity
Avoid Artifacts with High Integration Complexity
Avoid Artifacts with High Fan-In
Avoid Artifacts with High Fan-Out
Avoid Classes with a very low comment code ratio
Avoid empty finally blocks
Avoid Artifacts with lines longer than 120 characters
Avoid empty catch blocks
Avoid Classes with a High Number Of Children
Avoid Classes with a High Public Data Ratio
The exception Exception should never been thrown Always Subclass Exception and throw the subclassed Classes
Avoid unreferenced Interfaces
Avoid undocumented Methods
Avoid large Artifacts - too many Lines of Code
Avoid Methods with a very low comment code ratio
Avoid catching an exception of type Exception, RuntimeException, or Throwable
Avoid unreferenced Methods
Never exit a finally block with a return
Avoid unreferenced Data Members
Avoid using finalize
Avoid Stateful Beans not removed
Avoid unsecured EJB remote method
Avoid missing default in switch statements
Avoid using a break statement in 'for' loops
Avoid Struts 2 Validator field not referencing a java class field
Struts 2 Validation: Avoid unused validation form
Avoid hardcoded network resource names
Use dedicated stored procedures when multiple data accesses are needed (ASCPEM-PRF-10)
